page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: Like many rural schools, there was a questionmark over the future of the village primary school in the 1970's and early 1980's. In 1985 the school has 43 pupils and 2 teachers, including Mr.Elrick the headmaster. There are visiting specialist teachers in music, art, and remedial education. The roll will soon rise to over 50 pupils and an extra teacher will be employed. Secondary school pupils in Fetterangus take the school bus to Mintlaw Academy. This comprehensive school was opened in 1981 just south of the survey block. The nearest technical college is at Fraserburgh and the F.E. institutions in Aberdeen.
